fields.description:
Unable to create a branch with branch types if its prefix is occupied

h2. Summary
Due to Git spec, it's unable to create a branch if its prefix is preoccupied as other branch's name and vice versa.\\
This also possibly happens to [branching model|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/branching-a-repository-223217999.html#BranchingaRepository-branching_modelTheBranchingmodel].

h2. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a branch named "feature"
* Enable "Feature" in branching model configuration

** !1723269883-Screenshot%202018-11-19%2012.02.11.png|thumbnail!
* Try creating a branch prefixed "feature/"

** !3285735272-Screenshot%202018-11-19%2012.02.01.png|thumbnail!

h2. Expected Results
The error message should clarify why branch creation fails like below or guide how to apply the workaround.

{code}
fatal: cannot lock ref 'refs/heads/release/20181119': 'refs/heads/release' exists; cannot create 'refs/heads/release/20181119'
{code}

h2. Actual Results
The below error message is shown:

bq. We couldn't create a branch\\
If this keeps happening, contact support.


h2. Notes
The error can occur the other way round:

* Enable "Release" in branching model configuration
* Create a branch prefixed "release/"
* Try creating a branch named "release"

** !4207027971-Screenshot%202018-11-19%2012.00.36.png|thumbnail!

In this case, the branch creation page better to make users unable to specify reserved names (feature, bugfix, hotfix, release).

h2. Workaround
Rename or delete the pre-existing branch which blocks prefix.
fields.summary: Unable to create a branch with branch types if its prefix is occupied

fields.description:
The Docker authorization plugin currently doesn't support named volumes for Docker compose (see https://docs.docker.com/compose/compose-file/#volumes). As a result, mappings to named volumes are being treated as absolute paths and subsequently error.

A workaround is to create and map and empty directory and attach it to both containers.
fields.summary: Add support for Docker Compose named volumes

fields.description:
Dear support-team,

it took me quite some time to find the hidden profile icon :-)

!2278126675-2018-11-17_23h03_11.png|thumbnail!

I would expect a standard icon for the avatar picture.

Thanks a lot,\\
Philipp
fields.summary: No logout-button found

fields.description:
A significant update for people who build docker containers pulling from resources secured by ssh (for example a private bitbucket repo).

It supports --ssh which acts as an ssh agent socket forwarder, giving access to whatever the host can access without having to do things like pass in an ssh key, mount it or other insecure workarounds.

https://github.com/docker/docker-ce/releases/tag/v18.09.0
fields.summary: Support BuildKit on Pipelines

fields.description:
My pipelines frequently get stuck running the command {{pecl install imagick}}. Sometimes after stopping and restarting the pipeline it works. Today I've tried that 5 times and it still won't complete the command.

It usually looks like this:

{code}
+ pecl install imagick
WARNING: channel "pecl.php.net" has updated its protocols, use "pecl channel-update pecl.php.net" to update
downloading imagick-3.4.3.tgz ...
Starting to download imagick-3.4.3.tgz (245,410 bytes)
...................................................done: 245,410 bytes
19 source files, building
running: phpize
Configuring for:
PHP Api Version:         20160303
Zend Module Api No:      20160303
Zend Extension Api No:   320160303
{code}
fields.summary: Pipeline stuck at `pecl install imagick`

fields.description: I have my repository, its 300+- MB on my local machine and on server it says that its 1.8gb which is impossible.
fields.summary: BitBucket cloud space usage much higher than on client (up to 6x bigger)

fields.description:
Dear Engineers,

There's a bug with the markdown listing in the README files.\\
The " {{" can be used for listing, but if we put space/tabs in front of the "}} ", it's not going to list the content.

It's going to do the listing:

{code}
1
2
3
4
{code}

Not doing the listing:\\
{{1 2 3 4}}

Thank you for your help,\\
Norbert
fields.summary: Listing is not working with "```" if the backticks have spaces/tabs in front of them in README file

fields.description: "Repo activity is currently unavailable". Not able to see commits in Recent activity. Previously closed issue (with recent activity) BCLOUD-14156
fields.summary: Recent activity not updating

fields.description:
Here is my bitbucket-pipelines.yml:

{code}
# This is a sample build configuration for JavaScript.
# Check our guides at https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/14UWN for more examples.
# Only use spaces to indent your .yml configuration.
# -----
# You can specify a custom docker image from Docker Hub as your build environment.
image: node:10.13.0

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        caches:
          - node
        script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.
          - npm config set -g production false
          - npm install
          - npm test
{code}

The nodejs version I specified is 10.13.0 however the logs show that the default version 6.9.4 is used:

{code}
+ npm test
npm info it worked if it ends with ok
npm info using npm@3.10.10
npm info using node@v6.9.4
npm info lifecycle frezy_server@1.0.0~pretest: frezy_server@1.0.0
npm info lifecycle frezy_server@1.0.0~test: frezy_server@1.0.0
> frezy_server@1.0.0 test /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build
> mocha router/**/*.test.js
/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/utils/utils.js:57
exports.get_rate = async (crypto, currency) => {
                         ^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token (
{code}
fields.summary: pipeline test environment doesn't use correct node.js version

fields.description:
Today I found a pull request which I was certain I had created but it said the author was someone else. After some enquires with reviewers and some testing I found that when you create a pull request with a source/target branch combination for which there's already a PR in the system, the original has its description and reviewers updated without warning.

Expected behaviour: the user is blocked from creating the pull-requests with a message indicating that one already exists.
fields.summary: Creating a Pull Request for a source/target branch combination which already exists updates the original PR

fields.description:
When attempting to revert a PR which would cause conflicts and needs to be fixed locally, all that Bitbucket throws on the user interface is "Something went wrong" + an error code.

It would be nice to have a message stating that reverting the PR would cause a conflict, and for this reason, the conflicts need to be fixed locally before proceeding.
fields.summary: Add a proper error message for revert PR commits with merge conflicts

fields.description:
h2. Summary
If you're rendering an .rst file with "reStructuredText" syntax mode, and you want to just print a code block with the "@" character sign, it will tag someone else's account.

Steps to reproduce:\\
*From*:

!231304054-RST_1.png|thumbnail!

*To*:\\
!858717473-RST_2_preview.png|thumbnail!

h2. Expected Result
Preview will just marked the string as code block and not tagging someone

h2. Actual Result
The code block is tagging someone else's account
fields.summary: RST File is tagging someone when using @ character in a code block

fields.description:
Through a recent API behaviour change, permissions seem to be broken for simple read-only access to repository data.

The last known working call dates from 13 Nov 2018, 4:02:34 PM CET to

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/<team-name>/members

A recent call just returned "Forbidden."

h2. I had to change the permissions to
This group has the following repository access\\
Read access to new team repositories

h2. This group has the following team permissions\\
Create repositories Can create repositories for team
This account is a team member of the used team name. We only need read permission, no write or admin anywhere.
fields.summary: Forbidden for only read access to team and repositories

fields.description:
I have some repositories that contain only a Dockerfile and a bitbucket-pipelines.yml for building and pushing an image (used as base image or pipeline image for other repositories). Setting the language of these repositories to "Docker" seems reasonable to me.

If you are asking yourself if "Docker" is a language: Dockerfiles are clearly written in a domain specific language. I don't know it's name, but "Docker" is a good fit :-)
fields.summary: Add "Docker" as selectable language in Settings > General Details for repositories

fields.description: It is quite jarring to go from developing on dark to using the light. I would prefer a dark theme, similar to most IDE options.
fields.summary: Add Dark Theme

fields.description: I love the "My Work" view in BB cloud.  However, there is a column under the "Pull requests to review" view that shows the reviewers and their review status.  Sometimes a reviewer may have many reviews to attend to.  It would be nice if the current user's status for each review was shown separately or at least the first person in the review list.  This would make it much easier to find the reviews you have not attended to yet.  Often times the current user's name is buried under the or "+" image meaning more reviewers.
fields.summary: Reviewers list on My Work should show current user first

fields.description:
We have a Repository with a few branches the problem in particular is that a folder with a few files doesnt exist in the one branch but when we create a PR from the branch that does have this folder and files t othe one that doesnt it reports a conflict and it conflicts with code that is in a COMPLETELY unrelated file.

!3508956744-screenshot_469.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
When merging a Pull Request from a Forked Repository via a Merge Commit, it will send two webhooks requests.  If there is pipelines enabled, you will see two pipelines build triggered for the same commit simultaneously.

* Please note that this only affects Mercurial based repositories
fields.summary: Webhook is sent twice on a merge commit when merged via PR from a forked repository

fields.description:
In URL: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/xxx/groups/

We have over 50 groups to organise our many users.

These are presented in a jumbled order.

Can you please present these groups in an ordered list, rather than jumbled up.
fields.summary: As a user with lots of groups, I'd like them ordered, so that it's easier to find the group I'm after

fields.description: In long pull requests, like release branches, bitbucket shows an 'X commits not shown' message with no option to click to show the commits. This is not good when looking through the list of commits to check what feature branches were included in the PR and to check no unwanted commits were added.
fields.summary: Commits not shown in pull requests

fields.description:
When trying to setup integrations with Bitbucket Cloud, some services face the following issues:

# Have the IP address hard block for security reasons (DDoS) (not possible to whitelist the IP addresses).
# The services do not have a static IP or their documentation is outdated, not being possible to whitelist all their IP addresses.

It would be great if domain whitelisting can be used as an alternative in this scenario as it would help customers that are using services like:

# Jenkins
# AWS
# Azure
fields.summary: Allow users to whitelist domains instead of just static IP addresses.

fields.description:
There is a bug where we have

a) A Team\\
b) Branch permissions set up for people in that team\\
c) One person leaves the team\\
d) You get 'An unexpected error occurred' when you try to add new users to the existing branch permission

Take the existing branch permission

!4031370651-Screenshot%20from%202018-11-13%2009-04-04.png|thumbnail!

The 2nd listed user has left the team but still appears on this listing.

Then I click the pencil icon to 'Edit branch permission'. I see the following:

!168493060-Screenshot%20from%202018-11-13%2009-09-17.png|thumbnail!

I see (correctly) only the 2 users who are still in the team. The one who has left does not appear.

Then I want to add a new team member. When I add them to both the 'Write access' and 'Merge via pull request' sections, then click 'Save'. I get the following 'An unexpected error occurred' error message.

!3743827771-Screenshot%20from%202018-11-13%2009-04-34.png|thumbnail!

The only work-around I can find is to delete the branch permission and create a new replacement one.

What I would expect the behaviour to be is as follows:

# The user who has left the team should no longer appear on the listing of all branch permissions (screenshot 1).
# There should not be the unexpected error message when you try to add a new team member to an existing permission.
fields.summary: Can't change branch permission when someone has left team

fields.description:
The list of Jira issues in tab Issues is not complete. In my case, there should be listed 7 issues but only the 3 are shown.

The attached screenshot shows 4 unique issues mentioned in commit messages. (The list of commits is longer than the screenshot, there were 7 unique issues in total)\\
The second screenshot shows the only 3 issues that were listened on Issues tab.
fields.summary: Deployment Summary does not show all Jira Issues

fields.description:
We use "Kana - Kanji conversion software" for major Japanese input method.

It is necessary to enter the enter key in the middle of the sentence,\\
In the environment of macOS and Safari, the cursor is unintentionally linefeeding each time it is troubled.

It happens with both MacUIM and "Google Japanese Input" (Google日本語入力).
fields.summary: Unintended line feed occurs when entering Japanese Kanji characters

fields.description:
To reproduce, create a comment on an issue containing text {{@1x}} .\\
This matches a username, therefore it is replace with that user's full name, and displayed as {{@Aliaksei Verkhaturau}}

In my case, we have many comments that discuss images at different zoom levels, and therefore often encounter comments like "See {{@1x}} version of image". For my team and our clients, the end result is that our information is modified to be quite confusing. We would want the replacement for usernames that we know of, but not for total strangers.

(Note that to get this description to display correctly here in the Issue Tracker, I had to escape these terms using backticks. This would not be a realistic solution to apply elsewhere.)
fields.summary: `@` sign triggers username replacement when it is not desired

fields.description:
Anonymous Bitbucket Cloud 2.0 APIs call are returning 403 message instead of a 401 message and, for that reason, calls like wget, never sends the credentials it has to and just errors out.

Please fix the message sent when this kind of calls are done using "Anonymous users"
fields.summary: 2.0 APIs should return 401 to Anonymous Users.

fields.description:
This is an intermittent bug that is happening to our customers (on Moss.sh).

Moss adds the site deploy key (using the current 1.0 API) to the user repository so that the server can clone it.

The access key always gets successfully added to the repository (it appears on the list of repository Access Keys), but sometimes the repository can't be cloned.\\
This is the output of the clone command:

{code}
#!bash

Cloning into '/home/user/sites/dev/repo'...
git@bitbucket.org: Permission denied (publickey).
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists. 
{code}

If we try to manually connect to bitbucket via SSH with that key then the output is the list of repositories that can be cloned with that key: (which is right)

{code}
#!bash

ssh -i priv.key bitbucket.org
PTY allocation request failed on channel 0
authenticated via a deploy key.


You can use git or hg to connect to Bitbucket. Shell access is disabled.

This deploy key has read access to the following repositories:

organization/repo: deploy-key-dev@server (Added by Moss) -- dev@server
Connection to bitbucket.org closed.

{code}

We suspect this could be related to an internal inconsistent state in Bitbucket, because in some cases if we add a new (and different) key to the same repository, the first key starts working (as it should).

Right now we don't have any specific example of a repository where this bug if happening, but this bug has been reported by some customers in the last days.
fields.summary: Cloning with access key: Permission denied (publickey). fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

fields.description:
The OAI spec at https://api.bitbucket.org/swagger.json does not pass validation.

To reproduce:

swagger-codegen validate -i https://api.bitbucket.org/swagger.json\or

openapi-generator validate https://api.bitbucket.org/swagger.json\These errors seem to be causing code generation to fail, even when passing --skip-validate-spec.
fields.summary: The OAI spec does not pass validation (BBCC-1152)

fields.description:
In relation to the open enhancement request [#6705|BCLOUD-6705], a customer is asking if there could be a way to set bookmarks to follow the tip of a branch of a repository.

h3. *Note from the customer*
_Note that when there is only one head in the branch of the main repository, it is worse because we don't see the bookmarks at all in the "create a pull request page". For example, if there is a bookmark master, we can not create a pull request from this bookmark (which is what we want) so we cannot see the message {{There are no changes to be pulled}}. The problem is then that the bookmark master is not updated and doesn't follow the tip of the default branch of the main repository._

_We would really need such master (or @) bookmark following the tip of the default branch of the main repository to easily update the cloned repositories to this point to start a new work._
fields.summary: Mercurial: Set Bookmarks to follow the tip of a branch of a repository

fields.description:
Hello,

I am building an AWS Lambda function that backs up all my repositories on BitBucket. For authentication, I would like to use the OAuth consumer key/secret so I don't have to put my username/password into the Lambda.

I have looked at:\\
BCLOUD-6548\\
But I could not figure out how to do this. I have also looked at the documentation and could not get any wiser.

I have tried\\
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/hstart/testing/get/master.zip\\
https://bitbucket.org/hstart/testing/get/master.zip

and others with auth:\\
"Authorization":"Bearer ***************_" (_ being the OAuth consumer secret)\\
and also:\\
{key}: {secret}

Can anyone point me in the right direction?
fields.summary: Downloading zip file with API using Python

fields.description:
I have a PR with 84 changed files. That's pretty large but it's not _horribly_ large. And many of the files have only 3-4 lines of changes.

Initially, everything is fine. But once I scroll down beyond the first 20 files, everything slows down. Scrolling is terribly sluggish. My browser is even struggling to keep up when I'm typing a comment.

The new experience is a real pain for larger PRs (which are probably more common in enterprises). Do you have plans to optimize the experience?

Feel free to take a look (this is a public repo/PR): https://bitbucket.org/activeobjects/ao-plugin/pull-requests/76/merge-platform-5-java-11-version-to-master#chg-activeobjects-plugin/pom.xml
fields.summary: New PR UI (scrolling and comment entry) is sluggish for larger PRs

fields.description:
I think it would be a nice improvement if on the sidebar, a user is shown the number of open issue next to the issue tracker button. I have included a screenshot of my proposal for the interface.\\
!135039247-screenshot.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show Total open issues on sidebar

fields.description:
We need a way to close PRs without merging or deleting them.

For example:

* The work was done as a proof of concept and was not intended to be merged, but to get feedback
* The work was cherry-picked to a different branch

In both cases we want to keep the discussion in the PR, so we don't want to delete it.
fields.summary: Support closing Pull Requests

fields.description:
There is no longer a way to minimize individual file diffs while comparing two branches. This leads to very long pages that are very difficult to navigate.

This was a feature that existed previously and would be helpful to have back.
fields.summary: Minimizing file diffs no longer supported

fields.description:
I believe your service incorrectly computed that our repository size is 3GB. This is pretty much impossible. First a single commit that took no time to send pushed it from 1GB to 2GB. Then the reported size increased from 2GB to 3GB after we actually _deleted_ some commits.

Could you please run maintenance commands such as git gc, git prune on the remote size to get the repository size back to its correct range. We did try removing last sent commits in order to trigger an automatic gc on the remote size, but that doesn't seem to be working. In fact it seems to have the adverse effect - as described above.

This is time critical issue for us. Our work is currently paralyzed because of this issue. I have developers wasting their time waiting for this problem to be removed.
fields.summary: Our repository is reporting incorrect overall size of 3GB, when in reality it is about 1GB.

fields.description:
Olá,

estou tendo problemas após realizar a troca de e-mail na minha conta do bitbucket:

Conta antiga: lucas@gati.net.br\\
Conta nova: lucas@gatilabs.com.br

Em alguns momentos simplesmente perco o acesso aos projetos, como se estivesse efetuando o login em uma nova conta, sem projetos ou repositórios.

Com isso, não consigo publicar minhas alterações no repositório de trabalho.

Obrigado pela atenção

Att, Lucas Reis\\
+55(47)9.9927-2802
fields.summary: Conflito entre contas

Thanks,

fields.description:
Repro:

In the comments editor try entering the following text.  In some cases it will render it as code/preformatted and in others it just leaves the backticks themselves in, even when saving, and doesn't render them as markdown.

* `code` // ok
* (`code`) // nope
* (`code`) // then move cursor to parens and delete them; doesn't render markdown
* (`code`) // copy and paste this in directly; works ok now
* ( `code` ) // renders ok; now move cursor to padding spaces and delete them; still rendered ok
* code` // then move cursor to before the 'c' and type the opening ` character; doesn't render markdown
* `` // then move cursor between the backticks and type in 'code' (w/o single quotes); renders ok
* (``) // then move cursor between the backticks and type in 'code' (w/o single quotes); renders ok
* enter {{some text ->}} and hit space.  {{->}} is converted into a nice little arrow character. Now type ` and then {{code}} and then a closing `.  As soon as you type the closing ` it will turn the nice arrow back into {{->}} followed by ``code`.

It appears the markdown rendering is based on unspecified user behavior rather than valid markdown syntax itself.  Expected behavior is that if valid markdown is entered it will render correctly in all cases.
fields.summary: Behavior of backticks in editor inconsistent

fields.description:
Dear Engineering Team,

Can we have a feature, where end-users can convert their mercurial repositories to git without losing their wiki/download/issue pages?
fields.summary: Converting Mercurial repositories into Git

fields.description: It will be good to have a feature where I can link issue(s) with the branch.
fields.summary: Link issue with branch

fields.description:
Reviewing Pull requests would be much easier if it was possible to define default reviewers for specific folders/files in a repository.

Adding reviewers for a pull request takes time, and having the pull request automatically add reviewers for specific files would speed up the PR creation.
fields.summary: Default reviewers for folders in a repository

fields.description:
*Summary*
 On Bitbucket Cloud repository that is integrated with a Jira Cloud instance, user will not be able to directly open the Jira issue in the same tab from the pull request page. 

This bug is also affecting the "Jira issues" tab in Safari. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # On a Bitbucket Cloud repository that is already integrated with Jira Cloud, go to a Pull request page that is linked to a Jira Cloud issue.
 # Click on the issue key to trigger a popup dialog that loads the issue from Jira Cloud.

*Expected Results*
 The Jira Cloud issue will be loaded in the popup dialog without any issues.

*Actual Results*
 # The Jira Cloud popup dialog will request the user to perform a login:
 !2679691936-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
 # After completing the login, the dialog will show the following error:
 !4270065989-Untitled.png|thumbnail!
 # The error will appear even though the user is using the correct account with the necessary permissions on both Bitbucket and Jira to view the Jira Issue.

*Notes*
 * Tested with Safari Version 12.0 (14606.1.36.1.9)
 * This doesn't happen on Google Chrome.
 * There are multiple 404 HTTP responses in the console tab when it occurs.

*Workaround*
 Open the Jira issue in a new tab/window from the pull request page rather than on the same page.
fields.summary: On the Safari browser, Bitbucket is not able to link to the Jira issue from the Bitbucket PR.

fields.description:
The recent activity has not been available for several days now on my repo https://bitbucket.org/openrem/openrem/overview

Is this the same problem as happened before, for example issue ref BCLOUD-14156
fields.summary: Recent activity not updating

fields.description:
Had a merge conflict between a branch and master, while trying to execute a pull request, a popup suggested I do:

git checkout master\\
git merge --no-ff -m 'Merged in EV-88-have-more-accountability-when-addi (pull  request BCLOUD-28)' remotes/origin/EV-88-have-more-accountability-when-addi

When completed, the changes are directly committed to master, and I would have thought you would complete the changes in your branch and then merge into master.

Branch now cannot merge into master either, and is failing on the pull request merge with another bug already reported, the merge button spinner just keeps spinning due to an error that is not reported.
fields.summary: PR merge conflict - Bitbucket instruction is to git checkout master and solve conflict. Shouldn't it rather solve in branch and then merge all changes to master?

fields.description:
I have in the past half hour modified the branch permissions on a private repo (cloud bitbucket) to allow only myself to merge.

After this I commited some work and created a PR. This I merged and that all went fine. This was from a bugfix/ branch to develop.

Then I created a PR from develop to master and merged it. After the merge I noticed that was all done as a colleague.

How?

How was it possible that actions that I did were done under a colleagues name? According to the merge commit, he did it. But it was me.

In attachment, I'm the Deadpool pic (red/black) and the colleague is the teddybear looking avatar. I (deadpool) created commit 64b5331 as both the creation and the merge of the PR.
fields.summary: I just created and merged a PR as someone else - but logged in as myself

fields.description:
When I type to search input it does not do any thing to seach by branch name

!2568103674-Screenshot%20from%202018-11-09%2013-47-21.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Search branch name does not working

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We have couple of repository which is getting updated very frequently and it's hindering our day to day activity can you please check.

Below is the one of the repo link.

git@bitbucket.org:mediaiq/aiq-trading-center.git

Regards\\
Devops

Forking a repository fails with Invalid Project

fields.description:
I've noticed some problems with the deployment preview while running our manual deployment steps within pipelines.

Initally it was showing more commits than expected between changes and now it's only showing the last commit.

Currently our pipelines are kicked off with each tag, then we manually trigger deployments to staging and production.
fields.summary: Deployment preview not showing all changes

fields.description:
And expose this configuration through API (GET/POST)

With this, each one can enforce, repo per repo, the merge commit message template. No more "I miss this, I miss that", and no bad message with headless merges (like from the new Slack app integration)
fields.summary: Allow configuration of merge commit message in repository administration

fields.description: When an image is uploaded into an issue tracker as an embedded picture (and not as an attachment), when we export the issues from Bitbucket, the "embedded pictures" are seen only as a link in the .json file and the images are not included separately in the exported zip file.

fields.description:
Hi,

It seems that since BCLOUD-5652 was implemented, we have the ability in Bitbucket cloud to require a pull request to have a minimum number of approvals, before a user is able to merge it.

It seems however that currently users are able to approve their own pull requests, and have that approval count towards the required number of approvals.\\
This kind of defeats the purpose of this feature, I want one other member of a dev team to approve of a pull request, before it can be merged into a production branch. The act of creating a pull request could be considered the creating user approving his code (why would they create the PR otherwise?).

Taking into account that some people might have a use for this (from my perspective) odd behavior, I would suggest to make this configurable, somewhere near the required number of approvals field in the branch permissions page.

As a workaround we're currently requiring 2 approvals on PR's, and asking users to immediately approve their PR after they've created it, but explaining that to a developer is really hard...
fields.summary: [Branch permissions] Changes to pull request approval requests (prevent own approval from counting)

fields.description:
When I setup the Branch permission to prevent developers to push or merge directly to the develop or master branches following Git Flow branch strategy, but able to merge via pull request, this is how I set it up as shown below.

When I didn't add anyone else to the "Users and Groups" field in "Merge via Pull request", a developer didn't see "Merge" button even though his group has a write permission to the repo as said in Picture BCLOUD-1.

Only when I added his group to that field, then he saw the merge button.  Either that statement "*Includes users and groups with write access" is misleading or misconfigured.

Picture BCLOUD-1:\\
!1998599493-Screen%20Shot%202018-11-06%20at%2011.49.04%20AM.png|thumbnail!

Oh! and one other issue: to add more users and groups, you have to carefully place the mouse point right between that last group and the edge of the field (maybe 1 pt space?).   This UI is ridiculous.   First time we clouds't figure out how to add more users and groups.

!1152133951-Screen%20Shot%202018-11-06%20at%2012.02.00%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Users and Groups with write access to the repo do not have "Merge" button show up in pull request

fields.description:
Please enable the pipeline triggering mechanism for deletion of tags and branches in Bitbucket cloud.

The best CI/CD pipeline's function isn't just build and deploy, but must do cleanup when the testing is done.

You folks at Bitbucket have done such a great job with it and its pipeline, we have migrated from Github+Jenkins/CircleCI to BitBucket cloud.  While we don't want all that junks comes with programmability/pluggability of Jenkins, we still do need some essential functions.

While I can create a nightly job to check and compare the existence of branch and tags and force the cleanup, that's not ideal when the cloud vendor charges by hours nor security reason.

Something like this:

branches:\\
feature/*;\\
- step:\\
name: Deprovision from Test Env\\
trigger: branch-deleted\\
script:\\
- echo "deleting ...."
fields.summary: Trigger pipeline on branch or tag deletion

fields.description:
My company's profile is private such that none may see it.

When you write its url and you are not a part of it, a message of 'This profile is private' appears.

I believe it would be best if a simple 'This profile doesn't exist' message appeared or even a 404 error.
fields.summary: Suggestion: Private profiles

fields.description:
In Bitbucket Cloud, users cannot accept email invitations intended for their mail alias because it will result in Bitbucket Cloud prompting the user to create a new account for it.

Accepting it will result in a new account creation and removing the email alias from the original account to be associated with the new account.

This behavior has already been raised in BCLOUD-14335.

To avoid the above behavior from happening accidentally or by mistake by the user, the UI should provide the user with a clearer warning that if the email is an email alias, it will proceed to remove it and associate it with the new account.
fields.summary: Prompt the user with a clearer warning that their email alias will be removed if they accept an email invitation directed to it.

Bitbucket was unavailable on october 25th, could it be the reason why our commits are disappeared?\\
Thanks for your quick answer as this issue is clearly critical for us.

Vincent.
fields.summary: [Urgent] Lost commits on remote repository

fields.description:
I would like to enforce that members from the group "A", on my team account, do not see the user from the group "B" under the "Members" page.

Only the users with admin access to the team account would be able to see all members of the "Members" page of the team account.
fields.summary: Improve team "Members" page

fields.description:
We use Mercurial with the evolve extension (lab feature) enabled. Also, our repo is set to be non-publishing. This means pushed commits stay in phase "draft".

This does not work for PR merges. When a PR is merged in the BitBucket UI, both the close-branch and the merge commit have phase "public".

What I expect: The commits should be in phase "draft" because our repo is set to be non-publishing.
fields.summary: Merging a pull request marks the merge commit as public, although repo is not a publishing one

fields.description:
Its not that uncommon that you have a PR where ~90 of changed files only have changes in import statements (in our case those are scala files but it applies equally well to other languages)\\
Its quite cumbersome to focus on the "real" important changes cos you need to find your way through all those files which have just import changes.

It would be nice to have some features which lets you filter the changed files in a PR (by some regex or so)\\
This way you could filter out all those files with just import changes or just whitespace changes.\\
Just some idea. Maybe other ppl like it as well. Should also not be too hard to implement (take the patch file, apply the regex via grep, re-apply the patch file)
fields.summary: PR diff view: Support for ignoring files with only import changes

fields.description:
*PROBLEM*

*Team* still shows up on dashboard even after it has been successfully deleted. I believe this is caused by not removing all *Team* users prior to deleting the *Team* itself.

It seems the individual *User* still thinks the *Team* exists even though it has been deleted.

*SCENARIO A*

* *User* is on *Team*.
* *Team* is deleted.
* _Somewhere in *BitBucket* the *User* is still tied to the *Team*._

Since the *Team* was deleted before the *User* was removed, *BitBucket* still thinks the *Team* should show up on the *Team* dashboard.

*SCENARIO B*

* *User* is on *Team*.
* *User* is deleted from *Team*.
* *Team* is empty.
* *Team* is deleted.

My guess, *SCENARIO B* is what is suppose to happen. Has this happened to anyone else?

Either way, can anyone at BitBucket fix this for my account?
fields.summary: Team gets deleted before users are removed causes bug?
